str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From meros; to part, i.e. to apportion, bestow, share, or to disunite, differ.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Unmarried, of a person not in a state of wedlock, whether he or she has formerly been married or not. Unmarried.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.
And, even, also, namely.
Of unknown origin; a maiden; by implication, an unmarried daughter.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be over-anxious; with acc: To be anxious about, distracted; I care for. From merimna; to be anxious about.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
And, even, also, namely.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.
And, even, also, namely.
Wind, breath, spirit.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: To marry, used of either sex. From gamos; to wed.

The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from the base of komizo; orderly arrangement, i.e. Decoration; by implication, the world (morally).
Adverb from the base of pou; an interrogative particle of manner; in what way?; also as exclamation, how much!

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To please, with the idea of willing service rendered to others; hence almost: I serve. Probably from airo; to be agreeable.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
